Job Title: WAREHOUSING SUPERVISOR

Location: Danville, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.

But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.

That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It is why 80% of employees feel happy working at JTI. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, ten years running.

So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.

Learn more jti.com

Are you a skilled Warehouse Supervisor looking for a hands-on opportunity in the heart of Virginia’s tobacco country? We have an exciting position for a Warehouse Supervisor in Danville!

About Us  In Danville, Virginia, we take a pride in being a vital part of the community, contributing to the rich tradition of tobacco craftsmanship. As a leading tobacco facility, we are seeking an ambitious colleague to help us expand our manufacturing goals for 2024.

Why JTI? At JTI, we're not just building products; we're building a community. We value your skills and are committed to providing a supportive work environment. Join us in upholding a tradition of excellence in the heart of Virginia’s tobacco country!

What This Position Is About

You will be supporting the efficient and compliant operations of JTI Leaf Services storage and shipping operations at the factory and any JTI offsite storages. This also includes ensuring adherance to all product quality, traceability and safety guidelines. You will also be responsible for managing assigned Warehouse team (6-8 direct reports).

Who Are We Looking For - Requirements

At least 3 years of work experience, preferrably in Tobacco and/or warehousing industryForklift driver's license (with practical experience)Communication and teamwork skillsImpeccable work ethic and focus on growth

What will you be doing? - Responsibilities 

Maintain awareness of and ensure all policies and best practices are consistently implemented. Effectively manage warehouse staff and ensure they have a clear understanding of policies. Assist in training the staff as required. Monitor daily activities and inform warehousing manager if you identify an opportunity to strengthen any policies.Responsible for monitoring and managing inventory movements for adherance to FIFO and traceability policies as well as ensuring proper product segregation (both physically and within information systems) depending on the inventory status.Conduct inventory spot checks regularly to confirm physical and virtual case counts match. Resolve any inconsistencies identified. Train staff to conduct self checks as part of the daily routineCoordinate export shipments as required to any of our customers. This includes upholding all corporate and legally required shipping procedures through continual monitoring of activities and staff. Includes ensuring the correct product is shipped and all packaging and labeling is up the required standards. Also ensure all safety guidelines are upheld during the loading processContinually monitor and inspect the facility and all equipment used in the department. Document any building or equipment defects and report to manager and/or maintenance department to ensure any required repairs are implemented quickly to protect our people, property and products.Prepare and coordinate shipping plan for products being moved to any JTI offsite storage. Ensure product is shipped sequentially to support efficient and accurate storage of products by batch or MoPI number.

What We Offer- Benefits

Join a company that values its employees. Our benefits package includes

Healthcare

Dental + Vision

Voluntary benefits

Paid Time Off

Paid family leave benefit

401k Plan + Company Contributions

Life Insurance

Disability

Tuition Assistance

What Are The Next Steps – Recruitment Process

We are actively collecting CVs and evaluating qualifications.

We will be reaching out to candidates whose profiles best match the requirements of the role.

Please know that a negative decision is not a reflection of your capabilities or potential as a professional. It is a result of the competitive nature of the selection process.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
